metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14342 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
It was found that cifs-utils' mount.cifs was invoking a shell when requesting the Samba password, which could be used to inject arbitrary commands. An attacker able to invoke mount.cifs with special permission, such as via sudo rules, could use this flaw to escalate their privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14342` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cifs-utils - 2:6.8-1ubuntu1.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: cifs-utils package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:6.8-1ubuntu1.2').
